alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 26 at 2:42PM MST until July 30 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS BELOW 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions, with daytime temperatures ranging from around 103 degrees at Havasupai Gardens, to 110 to 115 degrees at Phantom Ranch. * WHERE...The Grand Canyon below 4000 feet, including along the Colorado River and Phantom Ranch. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...One important note, there will be occasional relief in the afternoon hours, due to passing clouds and/or showers and thunderstorms. Temperatures are likely to peak by early afternoon, instead of persisting all day.
info.instruction: This warning is reserved for only the hottest days of the year and is issued when temperatures are expected to rise to dangerous levels. Day hikers on Bright Angel Trail should descend no farther than 1 1/2 miles from the upper trailhead. Between the hours of 10 AM and 4 PM, hikers should be out of the canyon or at Havasupai Gardens or Bright Angel campgrounds, physical activity is discouraged. All hikers should have adequate gear, including a wide-brimmed hat, sunscreen, salty snacks, sufficient water, and electrolyte mix. Doubling your calorie intake helps maintain your energy. Hike smart.
